page.title: 05METHERSGATE HALL : SUTTON
page.content:
The Drive to{Methersgate Hall}is lined with coniferous and deciduous trees and beyond this are fields sown with sugar beet and barley.
It is a private drive but is open to pedestrian access only, this is because pheasants are bred in this area for the shooting season and it is patrolled by gamekeepers.
Some fields are left uncultivated and used as grazing for sheep and horses.
On the route there is a farm called {Cliff Farm}overlooking one of the many small woods.
The length of the drive is approximately one and a half miles.
